about_the_game:
Learn to balance chemical reactions in the most fun way possible! Throw the molecules onto the table, observe the visual helpers, and pull the lever when you've got it! Beat 8 levels in ascending difficulty at your own pace. When you reach the end, you'll know how to balance chemical equations!

Curriculum fit: Balancing chemical equations is taught in the curriculum of 8th grade Basic Chemistry in most countries. However, the VR lesson can be enjoyed by players of any age wishing to learn.

Download the free Lesson Plan under ‘View the Manual’ on the right to maximize learning from this VR lesson, including a short quiz.

PLACE PARTICLES ON THE BALANCING TABLE

Grab reagent particles and product particles and put them on the table! Particle model colors are indicative but their size and position relative to each other is realistic.

LEARN FROM FEEDBACK

Take a look at various visual helpers around you to balance the equation. Voice and text feedback will become useful as well!

CONSECUTIVE CORRECT ANSWERS COUNT

When you think you've got the reaction balanced, pull the lever to check your answer! You'll need three consecutive correct answers to pass a level.

LEARN MORE WITH EACH LEVEL

As you advance to higher levels, the reactions get more challenging and visual helpers are gradually removed. The particle models themselves might change to help you learn even better!

When you finish the game, take the test at the back of the Lesson Plan to see if you can balance equations on paper as well as you can in this VR lesson.
